intro: Psychotria rectinervis, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins on its dark green leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, white flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. Psychotria rectinervis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
